data.title: Martina Navratilova Motivational message and Quotes
data.meta_description: Martina Navratilova Motivational message and Quotes - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
1. Martina Navratilova... “you got served”! Part 7: World Class Sport Achievers

2. InspirationInspiration and Quotesand Quotes from Sportfrom Sport AchieversAchievers Inspiration and Quotes from Sport Achievers Brought to you by: www.dream-it-plan-it-do-it.com

3. MotivationalLessons  Martina Navratilova is a Czech born American tennis player. She is considered by many as the greatest singles and doubles tennis player ever. One of the reasons for her success is the fact that she played her tennis with so much energy, passion, and emotion. She was physically and mentally dedicated to winningthematchessheplayed.  Her winning streak of 74 consecutive match victories and the 167 top-level single titles was the best in the Women's Open Era. She played in what is considered the best women's matchofall time.

4.  Her grandmother was an international tennis player. Her father became her first coach when she was 4 years old. At the age of seven she was playing regularly, spending hours on court during practising sessions. She won her firstbig tournamentsasateenager.  Early in her professional career she re- evaluated her career and decided to surround herself with the best specialist support staff. It included a nutritionist, trainers, match analysts, and various other experts. She spent lots of time working on her physical and mental strength. This paid dividends because her tennis improved even more since then. She was continuously working hard on improving her tennis by practising and using the latest and best technologyavailable.

5.  Early in her professional career she re-evaluated her career and decided to surround herself with the best specialist support staff. It included a nutritionist, trainers, match analysts, and various other experts. She spent lots of time working on her physical and mental strength. This paid dividends because her tennis improved even more since then. She was continuously working hard on improvinghertennisby practisingandusingthelatestandbesttechnologyavailable.

6.  She had personal experience of what is involved in overcoming adversity in life and finding success. Some of the things that she had to overcome was the fact that she was stripped of her citizenship by her country of birth, she was diagnosed with cancer, and because she admitted that she is gay. Nevertheless, she kept on being an aggressive goal setter, as discussed in her book “ShapeYourself”andmadeabigsuccessofhercareer.

7.  Her grandmother was an international tennis player. Her father became her first coach when she was 4 years old. At the age of seven she was playing regularly, spending hours on court during practising sessions. She won her first big tournamentsasateenager.  She is an inspirational leader with strong motivation and candour. That is the reason why she was so outspoken on many issues, like communism and gay rights. She supports various charities that benefit animal rights and underprivilegedchildren.

8.  Martina has many other talents. She wrote five books and was the co- writer of three more books. She is a tennis commentator and involved in many charities.  Martina is a true tennis champion and a very successful person. She developed her talent through hard work, dedication, and motivation. Her goal setting and passion helped her to overcome adversity in life and to become one of the top athletes in world sport.

9. Best quotes... “Disability is a matter of perception. If you can do just one thing well, you're needed by someone” “Changes made to please others are unrealistic, but more important, they're unfair to you.” “The moment of victory is much too short to live for that and nothing else” “You can't live in the past, there's nothing you can do about it” “You can't live in the past, there's nothing you can do about it” “I think the key is for women not to set any limits”
